zone.line: Quite unsuppressed is tearing up the heart
Of the good Titan—as storms tear the deep
And beasts hear the Sea moan in inland caves
Darest thou observe how the fiends torture him ,—
Panthea
twice
Alas, I looked forth once but will no more
Ione
What didst thou see?
Panthea
a woeful sight — a youth
With patient looks nailed to a crucifix
Ione
What next?
Panthea
around
The Heaven above the Earth below
Was peopled with thick shapes of human death
All horrible, & ovrwrought by human hands
Tho some appeared the work of human hearts
For men were slowly killed by frowns & smiles:
And other sights too foul to speak & live
Were wandering by — let us not tempt worse
fear
By looking forth — those groans are grief
577 enough.
